usefulItems: bowl, kitchen towel, baking dish (30 x 20 x 5 cm), oven
title: Tiropita (Greek cheese pie)

ingredients.content: 180 g unsalted butter, cut into cubes
1 - 2 pinches ground black pepper, to taste
16 sheets filo pastry (approx. 375 g - see Tips)

preparations.content: Place 130 g of the butter into the mixing bowl and melt <b>2 min/100°C/speed 2<b>. Transfer into a bowl, cover and set aside. Clean and dry mixing bowl.
Place cheese into mixing bowl and grate <b>8 sec/speed 5<b>. Transfer into a separate bowl and set aside. Clean and dry mixing bowl.
Place milk, remaining 50 g butter, semolina and salt into mixing bowl and cook <b>7 min/100°C/speed 3<b>.
Mix <b>1-2 min/100°C/speed 3<b>, adding 1 egg at a time through hole in mixing bowl lid.
Add pepper and reserved cheese and mix <b>10 sec/speed 6<b>.
Brush a baking dish (30 x 20 x 5 cm) with reserved melted butter and set aside.
Using 8 sheets of the filo pastry, place 1 sheet at a time into prepared baking dish, brushing each sheet with reserved melted butter. Allow filo to extend over baking dish.

Pour reserved cheese mixture into lined dish and fold in extended pieces of pastry. Brush remaining 8 sheets of filo with butter and layer over cheese filling. Tuck edges of filo into sides of dish, then score top of pie with a sharp knife into 8 equal portions, sprinkle with water and garnish with sesame seeds (optional).
Bake for 25-30 minutes (200°C), or until golden brown. Allow to cool for 5 minutes before serving.

hintsAndTricks: Cover filo pastry sheets with a damp kitchen towel to prevent drying out.
Serve tiropita with a green salad.
